nn.examples

Class MajorityPerceptronNN

  • java.lang.Object
    • nn.core.NeuralNetwork
      • nn.core.FeedForwardNeuralNetwork
        • nn.core.SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
          • nn.examples.MajorityPerceptronNN

  • public class MajorityPerceptronNN
extends SingleLayerFeedForwardNeuralNetwork
    N-input, one output single-layer feed-forward (perceptron) network suitable for learning the majority function of N Boolean inputs. See AIMA p. 731 and AIMA Fig 18.22(a) for a training/testing graph. AIMA says that after training, each w_i should be 1 for i>0, and w_0=-n/2=-5.5. However other combinations are possible. For example, for 3 inputs, if w_0=-1.9, then the w_i can be +0.95 since 2*0.95=+1.9 and the PerceptronUnit fires at threshold 0. For 11 inputs (as in the AIMA example), I found that after several hundred training examples, the weights converged to w_0=-25.65 and the w_i had eight weights=+4.75 and three weights=+3.8. This works because 3*3.8+3*4.75=25.65. YMMV on different runs.

    • Method Detail

      • getOutputValue

        public double getOutputValue()
        Output of this NN is the 0-1 output of the only output unit.

      • test

        public boolean test(Example example)
        Return true if this MajorityPerceptronNN gets the right answer on the given Example. For this perceptron network, the single output node will have output (activation) 0 or 1, which must match the output value of the Example.
        Specified by:
        test in class NeuralNetwork
